text: This blog is very helpful! <https://www.maximiliankoehler.de/posts/pluto-server/>

attachments.title: How To: Set Up a Pluto.jl Server for Teaching Purposes
attachments.text: I want to share what my colleague Dennis Ogiermann and me learnt while setting up a server that I’m going to use for a teaching adventure with Julia. I’ll teach exercises in the course “Basics of FEM” for mechanical engineers. The problems The mechanical engineering students have no or little experience with programming (and very likely no experience with a terminal) There is no time to teach them in depth programming, terminal handling, etc.
attachments.fallback: How To: Set Up a Pluto.jl Server for Teaching Purposes

text:
HI, <@UUS6GL8BH>. I am stuck with the following error
```➜  ~ sudo /opt/jupyterhub/bin/jupyter labextension install @jupyterlab/server-proxy
An error occured.
ValueError: The extension "@jupyterlab/server-proxy" does not yet support the current version of JupyterLab.


Conflicting Dependencies:
JupyterLab              Extension      Package
>=3.0.0 <3.1.0          >=1.0.0 <2.0.0||>=2.0.0 <3.0.0@jupyterlab/application
>=3.0.0 <3.1.0          >=1.0.0 <2.0.0||>=2.0.0 <3.0.0@jupyterlab/apputils
>=3.0.0 <3.1.0          >=1.0.0 <2.0.0||>=2.0.0 <3.0.0@jupyterlab/launcher
See the log file for details:  /tmp/jupyterlab-debug-4rh6u6wf.log```
Which version of jupyer lab are you using now?

text:
you should be good to go if you do
```sudo /opt/jupyterhub/bin/pip3 install git+<https://github.com/koehlerson/pluto-on-binder.git@logo>```
Or you directly start with:
<https://github.com/fonsp/pluto-on-jupyterlab>, i.e.
```sudo /opt/jupyterhub/bin/pip3 install git+<https://github.com/fonsp/pluto-on-jupyterlab>```
which I would prefer, because then we can already test this for the most recent Pluto.jl version.

text:
w.r.t. permission, if you add a pkg with

```sudo -E julia 
]add Plots
using Plots```
will add Plots in the julia depot path folder (verify this, very important). If this is true, then you need to `chmod -R 777` and `chown juliausergroup` again for this folder
